website_summaries.verdict: The best panniers: where traditional style meets practical utility, making them suitable for casual rides.
pros: Large interior space of the bag is protected by a rain cover to keep inside contents dry during bad weather
The backs of the bags include a quick attach and release mechanism that quickly grabs onto the rear rack
cons: Exterior quality of the bags are not as good as other options made of high quality fabrics or plastics

customer_reviews.title: Video Review!!!
customer_reviews.text: Watch its unboxing and review video in HD on my Youtube channel: skyforce95
customer_reviews.author: skyforce95

customer_reviews.title: The bag is under warranty but what good is the warranty if you never hear back from ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the clips broke and I emailed the company eight days ago for either a replacement part or replacement bag but have not heard back. The bag is under warranty but what good is the warranty if you never hear back from the company? These bags are also on the smaller side, and I wish there were more pockets. The lack of a shoulder strap makes carrying these bags a real pain, especially when you are using two of them--forget about carrying anything else. Overall, I wish I bought a different par of panniers!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Very nice option with Ibera rack.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty nice for the price (I'm comparing them to laptop bags). I have an Ibera rack and they snap on very securely and come off really easily. My 15-inch MacBook.pro (in a separate laptop case) fits fairly easily. The only thing I could wish for is a shoulder strap (or backpack straps) of some sort, but none of the panniers seem to have shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Techie

customer_reviews.title: Quality but the bottom clip is not for all bikes and no security feature
customer_reviews.text: The bottom hook does not rotate as it seemed on the original instructions These are great and will fasten velcro ties to the bottom hooks to keep them secure. I do need to take these off when I go to the grocery store as they can easily be taken by anyone who has the common sense to know how to lift them. the velcro will make it a bit annoying to secure constantly but these are so nice that I don't care. I don't mind taking them into the store and using them to pack the groceries up in. Saves me a trip. could not ask for higher quality material for my bike that I take everywhere now.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Bike Taskers Delight
customer_reviews.text: As a bicycle tasker (groceries, errands, etc.), the Iberia PakRak continues to please. I find the top pocket and its placement is great for stashing stuff without having to open bag. At first I thought I the bags would be too small, but after serval double pannier grocery rides, all can be carried. I did have to modify the bottom clip (I used an old clip from another bag) as the original clip didn’t swivel into the right place for my bike rack. It was a minor modification. My only wish is for a longer handle strap that could be thrown over ones shoulder for easier transport. Support minor and not a deal breaker. Well made!
customer_reviews.author: R. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, functional, sturdy, roomy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy on. Easy off. Plenty of room to store groceries or things you need on the road. Plenty of high-viz reflectors placed around the bag to increase visibility. Would give it five stars if it didn't taper so much toward the bottom as it squeezes the bottom of a paper grocery bag. Overall I'm very happy with these bags.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great panniers for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: I get more use from of these panniers. They are easy on - easy off. Made well and hold more than you would think just by look at them. My only concern is how long the fasteners that hold them to the rack will last and if you can buy replacements should one break.Wish there was a clasp hook inside the outside pockets to attached keys or a pouch for small items since if you forget and leave them unzipped and open the pannier, everything falls out.
customer_reviews.author: chk

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and fit securely
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use these bags for quick trips to the grocery store and so far they are working out very well. I love that I can use them one at a time or both together. Had no problem adjusting the clips to fit my non-Ibera rack and they clip on very securely. Each is big enough to hold a full gallon of milk plus a number of other items. They come with a thick plastic sheet that fits into a pouch in the back that work as a stiffener. Mine were just a touch too big so a quick trim and rounding off of the corners did the trick. Would recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Hilda Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to clip on/off, great value
customer_reviews.text: Super tough material, great design, easy to get on and off. Works best on carriers with horizontal bottom bars, though. The bottom clip doesn't fit super well for my Cannondale rack, but it still works (see pic). Also didn't see in any other reviewers' pics, but there are removable pieces of plastic to stick in the sides for better support. Rain flys keep out the water well. Great product at a hard-to-beat price.
customer_reviews.author: Claire M.

customer_reviews.title: Attachment Mechanism Sticks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my first bike touring set up and they work great. The included rain covers work great, but if you are stuffing these packs to the max you will have trouble getting them on. The only real problem with these bags I have is that the attachment mechanism often sticks when they're placed on the rack, and require you to use something to manually press on the orange latch behind the clip that holds them in place. All in all pretty fair for the price. If you're like me looking for a first bike touring set up to see if you like it- these will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron C

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lower cost quality option for panniers.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of light use, these are still working great. Impressed with their durability and quality. I used them during a week long bike trip last summer while camping, mostly paved trails. Then lots of day rides on mostly paved surfaces but some gravel as well during the time since. The bags do rattle some when on gravel, as expected with most panniers. The hook and lock/latch work great so far - when I first saw it, I wasn’t sure about durability but it has stood up for a year so far.
customer_reviews.author: L. Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great bags with lots of space! These work excellently on the side of my ebike for errands and commuting. If I were to change anything, it'd be to add the ability to raise and lower the bottom clip, and to have its size adjustable. As is, that bottom clip just barely makes contact on my bike's rack. That said, the top clips are excellent and the bag's not going anywhere! Would definitely recommend these to anyone in the market -- for the price of a single high end pannier, you get TWO with more features than even some of the higher end ones.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Chutuk

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Ortleibs best but I really like the Ibera's ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before I bought some Ortleib's.. I really like the Ortleibs best but I really like the Ibera's too. In fact, their now my front panniers.. If it's not raining or wet out I actually like these more as their easier to get into and pack stuff in.. I don't know.. Do like me and buy a set of both.. Two sets of panniers don't go to waste on my bike, I manage to fill them all... Luxury cruising for sure.. Oops.. another hill... gotta go..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bags! Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are great bags for the price. I will buy another set for my wife bike. Used these for a vacation and had plenty of room. I didn't have to deal with them in the rain so only gave it 4 stars for that, and for security it only has basic closures. As far as attaching to the rack, the spring loaded clips are amazing. Be sure to buy the right rack though!
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Nanko

customer_reviews.title: Great Saddlebags!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pak rak rack and a couple cheap bags. After wearing a hole in them due to swinging into the spokes, I figured it was time to buy some quality bags. I got these and love them. No more swinging into the spokes when I’m riding hard. Lots of space for stuff. They come on and off so easily, it’s great. There is the potential of them being stolen, so I’ll usually lock them with the bike. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swehla

customer_reviews.title: Affordable bike nomad panniers.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy overall. I'm running two sets along with an Iberia trunk bag and top tube bag. Decent capacity. Exterior seems durable. I don't overload the bags with weight so I haven't had issues with broken clips or tear-aways. I would like to see an Iberia edition with metal clips/ fasteners.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Gioe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pair of panniers
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. The panniers are attractive and functional. The material is great and the bags clip onto the Ibera rack I purchased to go with them easily. Taking them off is actually a bit easier than putting them onto the rack, but neither is difficult and when they click-lock onto the rack they are held securely in place. I feel like the price I paid (~$60) is a very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for commuting
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for the daily commute (9 miles each way) for the past two years and both are still in good shape. The only complaint I have is the clips lost their springs, but they still hang on to the rack, even over bumps. In the bags I carry a 13" laptop with accessories, a change of clothes, a bike lock, a spare tube, some small tools, a first aid kit, and a little food. There's plenty of room for all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Best bags in this price range
customer_reviews.text: Great bags for the price! Easy to mount and dismount. The side inserts keep the bag upright and open for easy packing. The rain covers keep my stuff dry on rainy morning commutes. Complaints... 1: no smaller pockets inside for items that tend to get easily lost or for a lock 2: no place to clip lights to 3: no way to lock the bag to the bike to prevent it from being stolen. Other than that, these bags are great and I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Ccrow13.

customer_reviews.title: Good Panniers for the price
customer_reviews.text: They arrrived on time. Good quality. I use them for running errands, grocery store, hardware store, carrying things to the beach, etc. They attach and are removed easily with the existing rack (not Ibera) I have on my bike. I think if I take care of them, don't overstuff them, I should have them for a long time. Much easier than trying to strap things on the rack. Made my life easier
customer_reviews.author: Terry K

customer_reviews.title: Great panniers
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Put over a thousand mile on two sets my wife, my son, and I used bike packing over the summer. Over rivers and thru woods these painters have held up very well. On road or off they handle what you throw at them. Rain? No big deal with the included rain covers. Go on and off the rack with ease. The handles due kinda get in the way of using the top of the rack but I found a fix for that. They are also plenty big enough for all you stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Steffens

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money I like these. I do not like the new type of roll up tops but prefer this type of flap to close them. I Like how they include plastic sleeves to hold the bags opened up inside. I also like the top pockets to store items I need quick access to. The locking clips with the quick release work great and hold the bags on. The only issue is that it is hard to get the lower support in a position to keep in snug. It holds it in place but does slide a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Amy

customer_reviews.title: rain cover doesn't fit over the pannier
customer_reviews.text: I took one star off because the rain cover doesn't fit over the pannier (see photos). I took two stars off because I've contacted Ibera two times via email through their web site and did not receive a response either time. I had bought their bike rack and commuter bag and was impressed with the quality, so I bought the panniers and was also impressed with the quality of the panniers. But when a simple issue as the rain cover(s) not fitting arises, the lack of response to an issue this simple is telling of the company. I will be returning the panniers.
customer_reviews.author: Nature lover

customer_reviews.title: So much space! Easy to mount and unmount for grocery shopping
customer_reviews.text: What I love about these is the ease to un-mount them when I go grocery shopping. I always worry about stuff being picked off my bikes when I go into stores, it's the only thing I think about while shopping and rushes my trips. But with these I can take them off in seconds, throw them in my shopping cart and be about my marry way, and I don'y have to worry about plastic bags! The included waterproof covers was a plus, I didn't even realize they came with them when I purchased. Thank you, Ibera!
customer_reviews.author: itemno530

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with many carriers
customer_reviews.text: Do not believe the description where it says it is compatible with most carriers. There is only about 6" of distance between the top and bottom clips. I have probably owned 10 different carriers in my lifetime, and this bag would not be compatible with any of them. Your carrier must have a horizontal bar midway between the top and bottom. That being said, I like the design and I will be buying my 11th carrier (an Ibera, just to be sure it fits) in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Grover C Tharp

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy & Convenient Like all Ibera Gear
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ibera rake and top bag first and used it mostly for carrying my work stuff. When I started going on long trips I bought these Panniers and this larger top bag.  Wow, better than expected. :-) Light weight, clips on and off and does not come lose. As you can see I loaded them full. Now I'm wondering how to make mounts so I can use them on my new, non standard, front loading cargo bike. Yes I love them and the Ibera system that much. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Smokin Paul

customer_reviews.title: Stores gear efficiently
customer_reviews.text: These panniers were perfect for our 220 mile bike trip on the Erie canal in upstate NY. My gear was easy to store and easy to find within these bags. They attached and dis-attached very quickly, and with one rainy day, the included rain covers did a great job in keeping everything inside dry. I highly recommend these panniers and have several friends that have purchased them since. They are also very satisfied so my experience seems to be the consensus.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Seems great
customer_reviews.text: These bags look great and seem to be made well. Altho, the description says there are 2 large inside pockets, but there is only 1. It also says that there are elastic bands hold down flyaway buckle straps, but there isn't. And it says there are 2 side pockets, again, not there. Quite a bit of false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Traci S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, enough storage, long clips
customer_reviews.text: If you compare with other bike carriers, this one is pretty decent in that size and it’s price. I would say it can fit your big school backpack into it without a problem. In addition, the clips of the bag are much longer than other carriers I have found, therefore those clips can attach your bags to the backseat of your bike Much more securely.
customer_reviews.author: YP

customer_reviews.title: Main problem being that they were not waterproof during heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Main problem being that they were not waterproof during heavy rain. over a 1,000 mile ride along the west coast of the US there were several instances where my clothes and gear were quite wet. The rain cover protects the top, front, sides it does not protect the back of the panniers, the side of the bag facing the tire. my hunch is that the spray from the back tires soaked through the panniers.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and looks to be a good size.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with the intent of riding the GAP and C & O trails this summer (340 miles). They seem to be well constructed and and they fit perfectly with the matching rack. There seems to be sufficient room for everything that I'll need for a 5 day trip. If anything changes I'll update the review. The trip is in July, but I plan on using it on several test rides prior to the trip.
customer_reviews.author: LDS

customer_reviews.title: Great for communting to work
customer_reviews.text: These are SOOOO much easier than the saddle bags I was using which I had to strap onto my bike and could not easily remove. These snap on and are then easy to get off. I ride the 5 miles to work and then back home 2-3 days per week on average so these are great to get my clothing and everything I need to get ready post workout in one bag and then all of my breakfast and/or lunch items in the other bag. I haven't been in heavy rain yet but the little bit I have the rain covers have worked very well. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: AmyS

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This are amazing panniers for the price! Was very surprised when I got them how nice they were. I was expecting something thinner, not as sturdy... so I am thrilled. I got these for my commuter bike, along with the Ibera rack and I love the quick release! The pop on and off in seconds and secure perfectly to the rack. The bags are big enough for beach toys, backpack to slide in or whatever you may need. Very happy with my purchase! They do include rain covers but the material itself is great for riding in the rain. I haven’t used them and honestly don’t keep them on hand.
customer_reviews.author: SSTrail906

customer_reviews.title: Good product, holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Well after installing the Ibera bike rack, the next logical step seemed to be a set of Bicycle bags. After an outstanding experience with Customer Service, I decided to order the Ibera Bicycle Bags. As these were a gift, I had to install them. Good fit, the many times we have been out riding, we have been able to pack quite a bit into them. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Choice
customer_reviews.text: These work well, were water resistant when left outside in the strong thundershowers in Florida, just a few drips inside - which is a lot to ask when I did not put the outer wraps on. I have the PakRak brand rack, these worked simply and easily to add to and remove from the bike. The handles on the bags are comfortable on your hand, but I would not expect to carry heavy loads off the bike due to no shoulder strap. Tailored looking, and on the small side for panniers. They do not shift during my commute, which has only moderate bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bags were easy and quick to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: These are roomy and worked well for a long ride. The bags were easy and quick to put on and take off. I removed the hard plastic supports on the sides. I felt they provided little benefit and added quite a bit of weight. My only complaint, as others, was the fasteners on the straps and not very strong. You have to be very careful snapping the straps on making sure they line-up properly or you could easily break them. I didn't experience any problems but I was careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but doesn't actually work
customer_reviews.text: Used this for touring. The screws coming out of the compatible pakrak rack will tear into the panniers and destroy them in under 3 weeks. Mine had the stitching at the bottom ripped after 10 days of riding, I had to use a ton of duct tape, and did drop stuff out of it a few times. They don't come with me anymore, and are in a closet now.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Love this bags and should of had them before as I used a backpack when riding , now much better as more room to carry items and more comfortable. Haven;t had any issues with construction or function of product , very well built and slips off and on easily . Like that they are two units verses one as there are times when I only need one. Great product and very happy with it . THANKS
customer_reviews.author: randy haller

customer_reviews.title: Good bags
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used these yet but they do look pretty sturdy for what I plan to use them for which is bike camping. I like the roominess in them and the fact that they came with a waterproof pack cover. Overall I think this is a good purchase for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Trumble

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Panniers
customer_reviews.text: I love how easily and securely these attach to the bike rack. Very easy to take off if you want to remove them from your bike. They are very roomy and you can pack a lot in them and because the sides are reinforced the items don’t get squeezed together. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife to use on a mountain bike camping trip. They held up well. She had no complaints. They were on realy rough terrain and had no issues with the bags detaching. Kept everything inside the bags dry. Nothing broke. They get two thumbs up from me. And they weren't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Thor

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good value. Plenty of space..
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Convenient. Lightweight and look durable with an attractive desighn. Mechanical clip on system, good, not great, doesn't always engage positively. Still does the job though with some adjustment. Would highly recommend. Very good value
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: They work great, attach and detach easily, and seem sturdy. I wish they had a shoulder strap, I will probably try to attach some eventually. But they repel water well and seem fairly light (for the price). I have the rack from the same company, and it attaches well, although it is a little tricky to get it between the two sets of bars.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these bags I had to replace my old ones so I bought this set for my Ibera bike rak. They are larger than I was expecting which is a good thing since I live on my bicycle. So these are used for going shopping for groceries, laundry and other stuff that I need. I really like the ease of them attaching to the bike rack. So in the time i have had them I have hauled a lot of product and yes I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MaxEmuzz

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: I had bought Ibera’s waterproof version of these bags and had one stolen. So I replaced with these at half the price and like them more. The are lighter so easier to carry into stores and the zippered compartment on top is so handy for quick to get items. I haven’t tried them in rain yet so can’t comment on water resistance. But the water cover is always available.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grazier

customer_reviews.title: I've now gotten to take these bad boys out on a couple overnights and they work ...
customer_reviews.text: I've now gotten to take these bad boys out on a couple overnights and they work great! They are smaller than I expected but that's my own lack of familiarity with touring equipment. That said, I'm loading up a road bike for my tour so probably not bad having a little smaller bags as to not put too much weight I think these 700c tires. I'm very happy with these bags and plan on purchasing one more set once I got my front pannier rack in so I can make sure the clip on.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the Ibera rack for my daughter so she could use her bike for commuting. Nice integrated system. Easy on and off the rack, and they hold all of her gym clothes on one side and work clothes and laptop on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Murphy

customer_reviews.title: recommended
customer_reviews.text: Good looking, large capacity holds all my grocery shopping needs for a week+ when both are used, much better than using handlebar mounted basket and backpack. Seems waterproof without the rain covers as I've been caught in downpours in southern Florida and content remained dry. Fits well to my generic Bell rack, easy to mount and remove.
customer_reviews.author: George Lol

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far
customer_reviews.text: Great! I've used them touring here In Southern California this summer and so far so good..strong still even after a few rugged bumps..I would need careful putting them on and off..but I'd do that with any brand..just make sir they are I correctly before you too####downgraded my review due to the lack of compatibility with other job ibera racks..
customer_reviews.author: Rez jr

customer_reviews.title: Good while they last, not so much endurance.
customer_reviews.text: These guys have lasted me for a little over a year on a daily commute, but recently the spring mechanism in the quick clip system has broken, which leaves me worried about the one bag coming off during my ride. That same bag has also lost its lower clip after the screw came loose while riding. Also had the top pocket zipper come undone, but I was able to sew that back into place. Overall they were good when they worked but they seem to be coming apart pretty rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check Rack Tube Diameter
customer_reviews.text: My bikes rack diameter was too larger to fit these. I used American ingenuity to modify the rack with cupboard door handles. Works great. If your racks have super skinny rails these work. Carry loads of gear. Easy on and off. Mount securely. Super high quality. I stuff mine with gym clothes, u-locks and everything else including a backpack. It would be nice if they included a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroku-hiroku

customer_reviews.title: ... bought these for my performer tadpole trike they work great locking system doesn't work for me on my bike ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my performer tadpole trike they work great locking system doesn't work for me on my bike rack. But they still work great they don't fall off when writing but still slip off easy enough know to take in the store with me to fill up the groceries in your snap back on when I get back. very happy with well-made. Jim L
customer_reviews.author: jim L

customer_reviews.title: Hard to attach
customer_reviews.text: If they made one of the three latches longer than the others, then it would attach easier. As it is, you have to align 3 latches at the same time to get it into place. I grumble every time I put them on. Easy to remove. The plastic clips on the cover straps have an quirky design that makes them a tad tricky to engage in the dark. Specifically, the split center guide can cross feed and bind. Overall the bags look great and get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Daily carry for commute
customer_reviews.text: Using these for my laptop and whatever else I need to bring to/from work. The lack of a shoulder strap is a slight detriment in the few instances I've had to carry them by hand for a long time. The clip on and off system is great and the bags overall are good so far. They tend to slide up and down the rack a bit if I hit a bump in the road but they've never fallen off.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: We took these bags on the Katy Trail in Missouri. Rode 250miles in 5 days through varied conditions. The bags still look brand new. The rain covers kept everything dry in the rain that lasted about 3 hours. Tons of room too! I could have gotten my gear for 6 days in just one bag. Very high quality for. Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: skicounselor

customer_reviews.title: Good size and build quality
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my 8 day bike tour. Good size and quality, but didn't get a chance to test the water resistance. The clipping mechanism may not fit all bike racks (if the tube it's clipping to is thick). Also, make sure it's mounted high above the wheel, as the bottom of the bags will eventually start rubbing against it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex N

customer_reviews.title: Requred some work.
customer_reviews.text: Look great, good workmanship, but even though they are supposed to work on most racks, they didn't fit my RadRover rack. Welded a couple of bolts to a correct sized rod, drilled through my rack (ouch), and ta,da!
customer_reviews.author: noel leckness

customer_reviews.title: and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these last season ('14), along w/ the rack and the rain covers, so I have a year of use as of this review (I bought this second set for my wife's bike) The bags are roomy, easy-on, easy-off, and easy to clean. Internal pockets for water bottles and stiffeners in the bottom and sides (removable) are nice touches. I bike in the mountains so for longer rides in thunderstorm season you need to carry more than just a shell. I use these panniers, rack, and, and top pack to carry water, shells, fleece, and all the a-coot-ra-mo. Highly recommend the Ibera system.
customer_reviews.author: and_or

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend getting to go with PakRak bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: The clip on/off feature is great. I originally got a different set of bike bags, and the straps to take the bags on and off were a huge hassle. I've been using these for about a month and there is no visible wear or tear on them. The volume of stuff these bags hold is impressive (I'm not an efficient packer, even when commuting to work). And while I have not had to use them yet, I appreciate that these come with rain covers. The material is thick and sturdy, and the way the top overlays, I would guess these would be pretty rain proof even without the covers.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Treimel

customer_reviews.title: have great reflective visibility
customer_reviews.text: A first time with panniers. These exceeded my expectations for quality and durability. I sent back an inferior set that was $20 less, but they were not near the value these are. These bags are reinforced with plastic inserts, have great reflective visibility, and the rain fly worked great. The locking mechanism secures them to the rear rack nicely and has a quick release feature. Next time I will buy a set for the front wheel as well. Zero complaints. Buy these ones and you won't be disappointed. Solid value!
customer_reviews.author: E. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Attachment is a bit higher than I'd like. Bag curls in at the bottom corners so ...
customer_reviews.text: Attachment is a bit higher than I'd like. Bag curls in at the bottom corners so it can be hard to get on the rack. Handle is mounted low, so the bag hangs funny when using the handle. Storage capacity is good. Attachment mechanism has been solid. I like the reflective features. I used an old camera strap with loops connected to the hooks to use as a shoulder bag and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bags at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a 325-mile cycling trip from Pittsburgh to Washington DC and they were the perfect size. They mount easily, come off just as easily, and the rain covers kept everything clean and dry in steady rain. I mounted them on a Planet Bike Ecorack on my Priority Eight bike. I am very happy with the bags!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Sweet deal.
customer_reviews.text: At this price the Ibera pakrak panniers are a sweet deal. I'd say that are almost in line with the well known brands but much better pricing. For lighter duty use these are just perfect. I suppose if you were going to cross the county or travel of epic proportion then I could see spending more. I carry about 30 lbs total in these and they have performed well thus far.
customer_reviews.author: erin fox

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient. My husband rides his bike to work everyday. He has one packed with bike essentials, and the other is packed with the stuff that changes daily (change of clothes, his lunch, documents that go to and from work. They clip on and off easily and hold a lot. The rain covers work so there isn't a problem even when it rain. Also, when one of the clips fell off, the manufacturer sent another without a fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. King

customer_reviews.title: Be sure they will fit on your rack
customer_reviews.text: Look carefully at the photos for this product to be sure they will fit on your bike rack. I think they would fit perfectly on a standard rack. But they do not fit on an E bike rack where the battery is integrated.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Keve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have the PakRak frame on my bike and the combo works together so well. They are super easy to put on and take off and there is ample room in the bags for all my daily commuting stuff (I usually only even need one bag)! I do have a large 15 in laptop and the laptop does not fit well at all. That's what a backpack is for I guess!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife's bike, and tested in a route of 800 kms in 5 days , raining almost every day. They work, nice fit , they are not water proof at that level , but for the price are excellent!.
customer_reviews.author: O. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These panniers are light, easy to use, easy to take off. They're a bit cumbersome to carry, if one must leave the bike and carry them, but otherwise, I have enjoyed having these with me this summer.
customer_reviews.author: bookandblanket

customer_reviews.title: Good set of bags.
customer_reviews.text: I generally like these. The keep my items dry, and are pretty sturdy. Provided you have the lower hook adjusted correctly, they will not fall off. I'd rather that they did not get narrower near the bottom, but understand the likely reason is so that they can maintain clearance from your feet. At first I had a little trouble hooking them onto the rack with all three hooks engaging, but eventually figured out to bend the top/bottom outward and the middle inward as I'm doing it, and that makes them go on easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kokopelli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect setup.
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Well made. Adequately sized to allow a good load without throwing you and your bike out of balance. Easy initial setup, then easy on and off as needed, without any concern for accidental disengagement from the rack. The reflective panels and included rain covers make a nice complete package. Exactly what I wanted for around town and long road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Faststep

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding all-weather commuter panniers!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for nearly 2 years in the Pacific NW. They have 2800 miles on them through foul weather and fair, and I’m 100% impressed with them. Mounting is sturdy and simple to detach, and the storable rain covers have kept the contents bone-dry for hours in heavy rain. Lots of great features, solid construction and a great price. I’d buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dumm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just finished assembling the Ibera rack on my Cannondale cyclo-cross bike. It was easy despite the instructions which made it seem more complicated. My bike has disk brakes and the rack fit perfectly. The rack and paniers seem to be of high quality. I got inspired to do more shopping using my bike after returning from a bike trip in France where we had panniers. I thought they would make the bike hard to navigate, but they don't.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So big for a medium bag
customer_reviews.text: I use these bags every day. I live a car free lifestyle, so I need bags I can take to work or go to the market. I have carried over 40 lbs of meat and veggies 5 miles with no problem. My rack is not Ibera's but it works. And these are the largest bags for the price that I have seen; and when it rains the inside stays dry without the cover. I am waiting on a really good tropical storm to see if the covers work, Just love these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond G Brush

customer_reviews.title: I commute to work on my mountain bike and these panniers work really well.
customer_reviews.text: I commute to work on my mountain bike and these panniers work really well. One of the panniers arrived was defective, I called Ibera customer services and they took care of the issue right away! Great customer service. I am mostly a fair weather rider, however being caught in a couple of rain storms the included covers work well and clean up nicely. I will buy other items from them knowing how well they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Lang

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with a bunch of carriers
customer_reviews.text: I believed their claim that this was compatible with most carriers. I have a pretty standard carrier, so I didn't expect an issue. The bottom clip only moves right to left, doesn't twist. So, if you need to clip it to a vertical or angled bar... you're outta luck!.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: All weather is NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these panniers, they look good, and they were easy to take on and off the bike and held quite a bit for my 3 day trip. However they are not waterproof even with the rain covers. they may do ok for a sprinkle or tiny bit of rain but not a thunderstorm kind of rain. I should have put a trash bag within it to keep my stuff dry but wanted to see how they did. Not sure how they will do for durability but they did hold up for my 3 day trip except for getting everything wet!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Chilton

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and locks into rack
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them for shopping yet, but they seem to be pretty large. They also went through a rainstorm and they did not get a puddle at the bottom. And that was without the rain cover suppled.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Zon Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Order the Ibera rack.
customer_reviews.text: I kinda thought this came with the mounting rack but that’s separate. Reading some of the reviews I trimmed the corners on the plastic forms so it won’t wear through. I’m using them with my existing rack but have ordered the Ibera rack in hopes that it’ll fit a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Snodgrass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect value. The only reason one would pass these up is if they had money for a nicer design, which the company sells. I don't like the PakRak logo on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Function
customer_reviews.text: I've used these bags consistently for the past several months - great product. These bags are big enough to carry, even more than the essentials, yet not bulky; causing handling issues. Easy on/off and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: CMB7694

customer_reviews.title: really nice bags! Well built and a great attachment mechanism ...
customer_reviews.text: Really, really nice bags! Well built and a great attachment mechanism when using a compatible Ibera rack. I liked them a lot. Ended up returning as they were too small for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: This is the best bike paniers I could ask for
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bike paniers I could ask for! They fit plenty of stuff for both my 3-day and 2-week long bike trips. I like how they disengage easily, most of the time. The waterproof cover is perfect and does a great job of keeping my things dry during rainy weather. Definitely worth the cost, these bags will last me years if not decades.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: These are quality with efficient pricing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the rack(necessary) , along with side panniers and top cooler bag. I love the whole setup!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ibera Bags (QUICK-RELEASE!!!)
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these bags are the quick release function. So easy to snatch off and bring in the house or into the market to ensure you don't buy too many groceries. For my needs these fit PERFECTLY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Love the ease on mounting!
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle commuting to and from work. these have done great. I load up about 30 lbs of bag and gear. Love the quick release for running into a store.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Sturdy, lock onto a frame well, look good, pretty easy to hand-carry before and after my ride. These are my first pannier bags. The first time I dismounted I kind of forgot they were there, kicked them, knocked my bike into myself and fell down. But that's not the bags' fault. And it's the kind of thing you don't do more than once, so.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Two deep bags that are easy to clip to my bike.
customer_reviews.text: Super Bike bags. So happy with everything about this quick setup and release bike bags. They pack so much, I have only used on at a time. So I have one bag for my ride to the gym and another for my long trip to the beach. Love these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton D Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Great product overall and well made. Design could be better but for the price i am very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lots of space, liners to add rigidity, pockets to store small items externally, included rain covers. fits 15.5 MacBook in a protective sleeve. Cons: clip system feels cheap and most likely will break if not careful clipping on and pulling off. Rain covers don’t fully protect All sides. In extreme conditions the back panel gets wet and thus things inside. No mechanism to clip together or carrying straps for when off the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Moerschbacher

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Fit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to have this product for my Rad Rover E Bike, but the clips were to small/tight to fit my factory rack. I'm sure they would be fine wit an Ibera rack
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: So easy, LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Love this on my Ibera PakRak Bicycle Touring Carrier Plus+ Carrier Rack IB-RA5. I bought two of these bags (one attached in photo) and they attach and detach so easily. They hold a good amount and are also easy to carry in your hand. I also love the smaller zipper pocket they have for keys, phone, etc.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 1/2 in bike rack bars...
customer_reviews.text: Thats pretty much it, if the bars on your bike rack are more than 3/8 inch, then this is not for you. My bike has 1/2 bars on the bike rack and this thing does not fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Spend-Money-Wisely

customer_reviews.title: Nice packs
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these for about 6 months and have taken them on short trips to the grocery store and work. They have held up nicely so far. Easy to clip on and off. Hold a very good amount of groceries. I'm very satisfied. Have not had to use the rain covers yet, they seem like they should work.
customer_reviews.author: Oldmanriver

customer_reviews.title: Great size and durability
customer_reviews.text: I've had these bags for a year now and I am very happy with them. They're big enough to fit almost anything, including a helmet and even a basketball, but they don't get in the way of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Selbig

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pannier for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few time since purchasing, and they work very well for my needs. The sides are more rigid, so they won't expand as much as others on the market. For me, that prevents the bag from interfering with my crank stroke. They are also likely heavier than others on the market, but if weight isn't an issue for you. My only concern is the rain covers, they fit very tight, but Ibera has explained to me the cover is very durable and will not rip or tear.
customer_reviews.author: Warren P

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: So far extremely happy with these bags. They look great and have performed great. I also like the ease of removal. I haven't tested them in the rain but they do come covers
customer_reviews.author: FJS

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Have used these panniers over the past few weeks to carry everything from groceries to literature for a non-profit event. They are built well lock securely to the Ibera rack.
customer_reviews.author: Tech User

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be all that
customer_reviews.text: Made a 200 mile trip with the bags. I enjoyed the ease of removing them at the end of the day to take into hotel. They attach firmly to the ibera rack. I havent seen their performance in the rain but they look like they should hold up.
customer_reviews.author: augustus

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pannier bags so not well versed. I just use them for commuting to work. They work great for that and love the Clip on feature. As well as the amount of space I have, currently only using just one since it everything I need fits in just one. My only critique is I wish there was a reinforced loop or hole I can put a lock or cable. So I don't have to unclip it and take it with me when I'm only making short stop.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Arias

customer_reviews.title: and easily worn - a hole was worn through during shipping ...
customer_reviews.text: fabric is very fragile, and easily worn - a hole was worn through during shipping from moving around in the box. corners of the inserts are very sharp, and will cut through the fabric unless rounded by hand, and even then will likely wear through quickly. returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These were as described. Roomier than expected. Very easy to install to Ibera rack.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Dobro

product_meta.title: Ibera Bicycle Bag PakRak Clip-On Quick-Release All Weather Bike Panniers (Pair), Includes Rain Cover
product_meta.description:
Description:

Clips on and releases within 3 seconds - no straps required! Ibera panniers can be used as a set or by themselves.

With the clever quick release system, Ibera PakRak Bicycle Pannier Bag is your best choice for commuting to work or school!



Features:

 * Smart quick release/clip-on system -With the smart quick release/ clip-on system, you can just simply attach and detach bags within few seconds - no straps required! Easy and time saving!

 * Compatible with most carriers -If used with Ibera PakRak Carrier Plus+, other top-mounting PakRak bags can be used simultaneously. For non-Ibera carriers, you can just simply attach the carrier by adjusting bottom hook position. The quick release/ clip-on system works on other carriers too!

 * Stylish design with multiple compartments -Top zippered pocket and 2 large inside pockets hold smaller items with a drawstring pouch for overflowing items. Elastic bands hold down flyaway buckle straps for a streamlined look and stylish design. 2 side pockets, Hand-carry straps and reflective trim that ensures night time visibility.

 * Secure 3-point connection - The design of 3-point interlock can further secure the bike panniers from side swing.

 * Bonus all weather rain cover -All weather rain cover shields items from the elements.



Specifications:

Material: Water resistant 1680D Nylon. 
Mount: PakRak Clip-On Quick-Release. 
Rain Cover: Yes. 
Capacity (pair): 30 L.
Weight (pair): 4 lbs. 
Dimensions (per bag): 15.7 in x 11.8 in x 5.9 in.
Load weight: Carries up to 19.8 lbs (9 kg). 
Compatibility:

Ibera PakRak Carriers Plus+: IB-RA4, IB-RA5 and most third-party touring carriers.

Ibera top-mounting PakRak bags: IB-BA1, IB-BA11, IB-BA14, BV-BA1.
feature_bullets: Smart quick release/clip-on system - With the smart quick release/ clip-on system, you can just simply attach and detach bags within few seconds - no straps required!

Compatible with most carriers - If used with Ibera PakRak Carrier Plus+, other top-mounting PakRak bags can be used simultaneously. For non-Ibera carriers, just simply attach the carrier by adjusting bottom hook position

Stylish design with multiple compartments - Top zippered pocket and 2 large inside pockets hold smaller items with a drawstring pouch for overflowing items. Elastic bands hold down flyaway buckle straps for a streamlined look and stylish design
Secure 3-point connection - The design of 3-point interlock can further secure the bike panniers from side swing
Carries up to 19.8 pounds , all weather rain cover included for each pannier

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
